text: That said, I think there's a growing case for near-instantaneous post-interview fact checking.
author: ColinHazelden

text: It derails interviews. I think it was Evan Davis who wrote a good piece on this. In a short live interview you have to let some stuff go, because otherwise you end up with the row they want, rather than the debate you'd like. Sometimes you get that decision wrong.
author: ColinHazelden

text: Too many people signing - but mostly too many people watching the numbers go up. It's an accidental Denial of Service attack!
author: ColinHazelden

text: (if you don't have long, skip to the young people by the Orwell pub. Hopeful and heartbreaking all at once)
author: ColinHazelden

text: This is extraordinary. If you work in telly/journalism and haven't watched @johnharris1969 and @JohnDomokos' work, I can heartily recommended it. A bit of time and informality given to people goes a LONG way.
author: ColinHazelden

text: Thanks for pushing me to this mate - as brilliant as ever. Those young people at the Orwell ... wow. @johnharris1969: can I ask about the ex-Asda Team Leader? Feels had. Doesn't like JRM. Would STILL vote leave. Did you feel you understood why?
author: ColinHazelden

text: Well, this is ... um ... something.
author: ColinHazelden

text: I am belching just THINKING about that sort of volume, mind.
author: ColinHazelden

text: Yep - I agree. 6x330 = 1980ml. Nothing sad about us spending time on this, no sir!
author: ColinHazelden

text: David does a lot of thoughtful work on Brexit. A lot. But he does appear to have nailed it here in a single tweet.
author: ColinHazelden

text: That is a sum I am in NO way qualified to do! I would guess at six or so? But I bet the interactions of the non alcoholic and alcoholic liquids in it are more complex than that!
author: ColinHazelden

text: Underrated tweet.
author: ColinHazelden

text:
Did you like it?

Spoiler: I really like it,
author: ColinHazelden

text: A motion to set aside that standing order? If May were confident of winning a vote on the deal, presumably she'd be confident of winning a motion to enable that vote?
author: ColinHazelden

text: So, @TwitterMoments doesn’t understand rugby union then ...
author: ColinHazelden

text: What a day!
author: ColinHazelden

text: And still ...
author: ColinHazelden

text: This aged well!
author: ColinHazelden

text: I see England are taking out their frustrations on the Scots. Plus ça change ...
author: ColinHazelden

text: Though, the actual Six Nations one looks reworked!
author: ColinHazelden

text: Watching the #6Nations presentations. Held both those trophys!
author: ColinHazelden

text: “Could”! Haha! WILL. It will get SO messy!
author: ColinHazelden
